stimulusHtml:
A college professor administered a survey to students from three different majors: engineering, nursing, and communications. The students were asked to identify how they prefer to be contacted: e-mail, telephone, or text message. The professor then used the survey data to conduct a chi-square test.

Which of the following best describes the null hypothesis for the test?
choicesHtml: There is an association between major and preferred method of communication.
There is a positive association between major and preferred method of communication.
There is no association between major and preferred method of communication.
One-third of all students at the college are engineering majors, one-third are nursing majors, and one-third are communication majors.
One-third of all students at the college prefer to be contacted by e-mail, one-third prefer to be contacted by telephone, and one-third prefer to be contacted via text message.
